Company: Caribbean Petroleum Corp., Caribbean Petroleum Refining L.P., and Gulf Petroleum Refining Corp.
Description: Under a settlement agreement lodged in federal bankruptcy court in Delaware, Caribbean Petroleum Corp., Caribbean Petroleum Refining L.P., and Gulf Petroleum Refining Corp.  Puerto Rico agreed to pay more than $8.2 million to address environmental liabilities relating to CAPECO's former petroleum distribution facility in Bayamn, Puerto Rico, and more than 170 service stations owned or leased by CAPECO throughout Puerto Rico.

Company: Caribbean Petroleum Corporation, MetLife Capital Corporation and Water Quality Insurance Syndicate
Description: Caribbean Petroleum Corporation, MetLife Capital Corporation and Water Quality Insurance Syndicate agreed to pay $83.5 million to the United States and Commonwealth of Puerto Rico to settle claims related to a 1994 barge grounding that caused an 800,000 gallon oil spill.
